important.title: Cucumber won't install!
important.p: Cucumber depends on a particular gherkin version. It will try to download it automatically, but if you already have a later version then RubyGems gets confused and won't download the version required by Cucumber. As a result you might get an error message similar to this one:
important.code: ERROR: Error installing cucumber: cucumber requires gherkin (~> 2.2.2, runtime)
important.p: To resolve this, install the correct gherkin gem version first:
Or just uninstall the previous version of gherkin if you do not need it for other reasons, and then install the latest version:
important.code: gem uninstall gherkin gem install gherkin

section.p: This is a very simplistic implementation for all the steps, that does not actually connect to any domain code. We go through all the details of the feature file and step definitions in . For now, you can probably guess that Cucumber uses regular expression after the keywords Given, When and Then to map lines in a feature file to step definitions.
